headline: BNY asks employees to return to office four days a week by September
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Bank of New York Mellon has asked its employees to return to the office four days a week by September 2 from a current three days, according to a memo from the bank's executive committee seen by Reuters.  BNY has required its 51,000 employees to work from the office for three days a week since the first half of 2023.  "Most managers are already in the office 4 days a week, and we have seen the positive momentum this creates."
